name: Parametric MST
description:
You are given 
    n
 integers 
    a_1, a_2, 
    …, a_n
. For any real
number 
    t
, consider the complete weighted graph on 
    n
 vertices

    K_n(t)
 with weight of the edge between vertices 
    i
 and 
    j

equal to 
    w_ij(t) = a_i 
    · a_j + t 
    · (a_i + a_j)
. Let

    f(t)
 be the cost of the minimum spanning tree of 
    K_n(t)
. Determine
whether 
    f(t)
 is bounded above and, if so, output the maximum value it
attains. Input The input consists of multiple test cases. The first line
contains a single integer 
    T
 (
    1 
    ≤ T 
    ≤ 10^4
) — the number
of test cases. Description of the test cases follows. The first line of each
test case contains an integer 
    n
 (
    2 
    ≤ n 
    ≤ 2 
    · 10^5
)
— the number of vertices of the graph. The second line of each test case
contains 
    n
 integers 
    a_1, a_2, 
    …, a_n
 (
    -10^6 
    ≤ a_i
    
    ≤ 10^6
). The sum of 
    n
 for all test cases is at most 
    2 
    ·
    10^5
. Output For each test case, print a single line with the maximum value
of 
    f(t)
 (it can be shown that it is an integer), or INF if 
    f(t)
 is
not bounded above. Example Input 5 2 1 0 2 -1 1 3 1 -1 -2 3 3 -1 -2 4 1 2 3 -4
Output INF -1 INF -6 -18
